lines.content: * The main chatbot class for Sai, a task management assistant.
* Supports adding, deleting, marking, unmarking, and listing tasks.
* Tasks are persisted using {@link Storage} and displayed using {@link Ui}.
* Greets the user with a welcome message.
* Displays a farewell message when the program ends.
* Adds a new task to the list based on user input.
* @param input raw input string (e.g., "todo read book", "deadline project /by 2025-09-01")
* @throws InvalidTaskTypeException   if the task type is not recognised
* @throws InvalidTaskFormatException if the input format is invalid
public void addToList(String input) throws InvalidTaskTypeException, InvalidTaskFormatException {

* Accepts user commands until "bye" is entered.
* Supports commands: list, mark, unmark, delete, todo, deadline, event.
* Loads stored tasks and begins the chatbot loop.
* The {@code Parser} class provides utility methods for parsing user input
* into structured components such as dates, times, and task details.
* It supports multiple date-time formats and can extract key phrases
* for different task types like {@code todo}, {@code deadline}, and {@code event}.
* An array of supported {@link DateTimeFormatter} patterns used
private static final DateTimeFormatter[] DATE_FORMATS = new DateTimeFormatter[]{
* Attempts to parse a date-time string into a {@link LocalDateTime}.
* The method iterates over multiple possible date and date-time formats.
* If only a date is supplied (no time), it defaults to 23:59 on that day.
* @param input the raw date-time string entered by the user
* @return a parsed {@link LocalDateTime} representing the input
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input cannot be parsed with any supported format
// Try parsing into LocalDate (if no time is provided)
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unrecognised date format: " + input);
* Extracts task-related phrases from a raw user input string.

*
  • deadline: requires a description and a {@code /by} clause

*
  • event: requires a description, a {@code /from} clause, and a {@code /to} clause
* @param input the raw user input string
* @throws InvalidTaskFormatException if the input is missing required parts or has invalid structure
public static String[] extractPhrases(String input) throws InvalidTaskFormatException {
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Todo Task cannot be empty");
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Deadline Task needs a /by statement");
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Deadline Task cannot be empty");
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Event Task needs a /from statement");
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Event Task cannot be empty");
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Event Task needs a /to statement that comes after /from");
return new String[]{firstWord, task, from, to};
throw new InvalidTaskFormatException("Inputted task does not fall under todo, deadline or event");
* Handles the saving and loading of tasks from the local storage file.
* Each line in the file represents one task in a specific format:
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* If the file or its parent directories do not exist, they are created.
* If the file is empty, an empty {@link TaskList} is returned.
* Lines that cannot be parsed are skipped with a warning message.
* @return A {@link TaskList} containing all tasks read from storage.
// Create directory and file if they do not exist yet
return new TaskList(); // empty list if first run
System.out.println("Warning: This line cannot be read: " + line);
* Saves the given {@link TaskList} to the storage file.
* Each task is formatted according to its type and written on a new line.
* Parses a single line from the storage file into a {@link Task}.
* @param line A formatted string representing a task.
* @return A {@link Task} object corresponding to the line.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task type is invalid.
default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid task type: " + type);
* Converts a {@link Task} object into a string representation
* suitable for saving into the storage file.
* @return A formatted string representation of the task.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the task type is unknown.
* All messages printed to the console are wrapped for formatting.
* Wraps a message with separators for better readability.
* Displays the welcome message when the program starts.
System.out.println(wrap("Hello! I'm S.AI\nWhat can I do for you?"));
* Displays the goodbye message when the program ends.
System.out.println(wrap("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"));
* @param message the error message to display
* Displays a message when a task is added to the task list.
* @param taskList the task list containing the newly added task
System.out.println(wrap("Got it. I've added this task:\n" + taskList.getTask(taskList.size() - 1) + "\n"
+ "Now you have " + (taskList.size()) + " tasks in the list."));
* Displays a message when a task is deleted from the task list.
* @param task the task that was removed
* @param size current size of the task list after deletion
public void showDeletedTask(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println(wrap("Noted. I have removed this task:\n" + task + "\n"
+ "Now you have " + (size) + " tasks in the list."));
* Displays all tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList the task list to display
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task the task that was marked
System.out.println(wrap("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + task));
* Displays a message when a task is unmarked (not done).
* @param task the task that was unmarked
System.out.println(wrap("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + task));
* Displays a warning message for incorrect command formatting.
System.out.println(wrap("Please format your message as \"" + format + " [task number]\""));
* Represents a list of tasks and provides operations
* to manage tasks such as adding, deleting, and retrieving.
* Creates a TaskList initialized with an existing list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes the task at the given index.
* @param index index of the task to delete (0-based)
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
* Returns the task at the given index.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the underlying ArrayList of tasks.
* Returns a formatted string listing all tasks in the list.
* Represents a deadline task, which has a specific due date/time.
* Inherits from {@link Task} and adds a "by" deadline.
* Creates a new DeadlineTask with the given description and deadline.
* @param description Description of the deadline task
* @param by          Deadline date/time string to be parsed
* Returns the deadline of this task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task,
* including its type indicator [D], status, description, and formatted deadline.
* @return formatted string of the deadline task
* Represents an event task with a start and end date/time.
* Inherits from {@link Task} and extends it by adding scheduling details.
* Creates a new EventTask with the given description, start, and end date/time.
* @param start       Start date/time string to be parsed
* @param end         End date/time string to be parsed
public EventTask(String description, String start, String end) {
* Returns the start date/time of the event.
* Returns the end date/time of the event.
* Returns a string representation of the event,
* including description, status, and formatted start/end times.
* @return formatted string of the event task
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* A Task can be marked as done or not done.
* Creates a new Task with the given description.
* By default, the task is not marked as done.
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns whether this task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task,
* showing its completion status and description.
public String toString() { return String.format("[%s] %s", this.getStatusIcon(), this.description); }
* Returns the status icon representing whether the task is done.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Represents a todo task, which is a simple task without a date or time.
* Creates a new TodoTask with the given description.
* @param description Description of the todo task
* Returns a string representation of the todo task,
* including its type indicator [T] and completion status.
* @return formatted string of the todo task
assertEquals("Unrecognised date format: invalid date string", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Inputted task does not fall under todo, deadline or event", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Event Task cannot be empty", e.getMessage());
Task task = new Task("Read a book");
assertFalse(task.isDone(), "New tasks should not be marked as done by default");
